meanings.definition: To make someone feel hurt, upset, or angry by treating them unfairly or cruelly.
meanings.sent1: The bully victimized the smaller kids by teasing them every day.
meanings.sent2: She felt victimized when her classmates excluded her from the group project.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous puppy victimized the cat by stealing its favorite toy.
meanings.sent4: The storm victimized the coastal town, leaving destruction in its wake.
meanings.sent5: The villain in the movie always had a plan to victimize the innocent characters.

meanings.definition: To make someone a victim of a crime or unfair situation.
meanings.sent1: The scammer victimized many elderly people by tricking them into giving away their savings.
meanings.sent2: The corrupt officials victimized the citizens by embezzling public funds.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous raccoon victimized the campers by stealing their snacks.
meanings.sent4: The virus victimized the computer system, causing it to crash unexpectedly.
meanings.sent5: The cunning thief always found a way to victimize unsuspecting tourists in the crowded city.
